chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Teagon M. Simplot

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on January 12, 2023 at 10:00 am.

03:14 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary Elizabeth Bricco and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Teagon M. Simplot appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Shanna Sanders appeared by video for Teagon M. Simplot. Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendant pleads not guilty, jury trial to be set.

10:35 AM Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Teagon M. Simplot appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Shanna Sanders appeared by video for Teagon M. Simplot. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information. Defense argues for bond modification, State objects. Court denies bond modification.
Arraignment scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.

3:33 PM Prosecuting attorney Alexander David Goulart and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Teagon M. Simplot appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Shanna Sanders appeared by video for Teagon M. Simplot. Preliminary Hearing requested by zoom, waiving time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.

04:33 PM Prosecuting attorney Gerald Anthony Urbik and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Teagon M. Simplot appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Colin T Nicholson appeared by video for Teagon M. Simplot. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Court orders $500 Cash Bond with conditions: No contact directly or indirectly with victim M.O., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. . No contact directly or indirectly with victim Cullenen Kovach. No contact with Rock River Grocery, No driving.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
